column4: Hello, I have an AMD 64 bit Asus laptop, do you guys recommend that I install the 32 bit version of ubuntu or the 64 bits ?
I only got 2gb
unless you need the 64bit arch, use the 32bit
only in theory
why not?
grab kubuntu then
choice is the keyword here
archlinux? yes
and what did you think of it ?
are you proficiant with the commandline?
go for it - its harder to setup
but way faster
I use it on my desktop
it supports a lot - I have never had any issues - but if you mean out of the box - I'd say no
arch is not supposed to work out of the box - after the install you don't even have X
if you are comfortable with that - just try it
I prefer using ubuntu for desktops if you don't want to configure anything
but servers are awesome in arch
well, ok - trust doesn't really have to do with it though - just take a look at the source :)
it is i686 optiized
same kernelVERSION
